How to explore a new base with glitter

Source: vignettes/articles/explore.Rmd
explore.Rmd
library(glitter)

Imagine you are tasked with exploring the Linked Data Service LINDAS provided by the Swiss Federal Archives. You might be able to read examples and docs if present. But in any case, you could get inspired by the Chapter 11 “SPARQL cookbook” of the “Learning SPARQL” book by Bob DuCharme. Let’s go through an example.

Asking for a subset of all triples

In the code below we’ll ask for 50 triples. Note that we use the endpoint argument of spq_perform() to indicate where to send the query, as well as the request_type argument.

How can one know whether a service needs request_type = "body-form"?

  • The docs might mention it.
  • Trial and error.
  • In LINDAS’ case if you run a request via https://lindas.admin.ch/sparql/ and use your browser’s web developer console at the request tab, you can see the request sends the query in the body.
library("glitter") 
spq_init() %>%
  spq_add("?s ?p ?o") %>%
  spq_head(n = 50) %>%
  spq_perform(
    endpoint = "https://ld.admin.ch/query", 
    request_type = "body-form"
  ) %>%
  knitr::kable()
p s o

This first query is helpful in that it shows you can do a query! Its results however can be… more or less helpful.

Classes

Find which classes are declared

At this point you might think you need to use some prefixes in your query. If these prefixes are present in glitter::usual_prefixes, you don’t need to do anything. If they’re not, use glitter::spq_prefix().

spq_init() %>%
  spq_add("?class a rdfs:Class") %>%
  spq_head(n = 10) %>%
  spq_perform(
    endpoint = "https://ld.admin.ch/query", 
    request_type = "body-form"
  ) %>%
  knitr::kable()
class
http://schema.org/GovernmentOrganization
http://schema.org/Corporation
http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Class
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#Property
http://schema.org/Place
http://schema.org/DataCatalog
http://schema.org/Dataset
http://schema.org/CreativeWork
http://schema.org/PostalAddress
http://schema.org/Organization

How many classes are defined in total? This query might be too big for the service.

spq_init() %>%
  spq_add("?class a rdfs:Class") %>%
  spq_count() %>%
  spq_perform(
    endpoint = "https://ld.admin.ch/query", 
    request_type = "body-form"
  )
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   n    
#>   <chr>
#> 1 1195

We can do the same query for owl classes instead.

spq_init() %>%
  spq_add("?class a rdfs:Class") %>%
  spq_head(n = 10) %>%
  spq_perform(
    endpoint = "https://ld.admin.ch/query", 
    request_type = "body-form"
  ) %>%
  knitr::kable()
class
http://schema.org/GovernmentOrganization
http://schema.org/Corporation
http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Class
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#Property
http://schema.org/Place
http://schema.org/DataCatalog
http://schema.org/Dataset
http://schema.org/CreativeWork
http://schema.org/PostalAddress
http://schema.org/Organization

Until now we could still be very in the dark as to what the service provides.

Which classes have instances? 

spq_init() %>%
  spq_add("?instance a ?class") %>%
  spq_arrange(class) %>%
  spq_head(n = 10) %>%
  spq_select(class, .spq_duplicate = "distinct") %>%
  spq_perform(
    endpoint = "https://ld.admin.ch/query", 
    request_type = "body-form"
  ) %>%
  knitr::kable()
instance class
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2099 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2176 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2200 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2477 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2450 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2304 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2319 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2369 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2126 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation
https://environment.ld.admin.ch/foen/hydro/station/2155 http://example.com/HydroMeasuringStation

Which classes have the most instances? 

spq_init() %>%
  spq_add("?instance a ?class") %>%
  spq_select(class, .spq_duplicate = "distinct")  %>%
  spq_count(class, sort = TRUE) %>%
  spq_head(20) %>%
  spq_perform(
    endpoint = "https://ld.admin.ch/query", 
    request_type = "body-form"
  ) %>%
  knitr::kable()
class n
https://cube.link/Observation 8721537
